editorialNotes.standard: This breakneck chapter in the Riptide GP series is so intense, itâ€™s got us reaching for a life jacket. Or maybe several: Renegadeâ€™s solo campaign packs tons of water-racing events and sick tricks to master. (Split-screen local and eight-player online matches are our favorites.) However you play, stunning tracks like a gorgeous forest river deliver awesome arcade thrills. On Apple TV, it's our 2016 Game of the Year.
editorialNotes.short: Manage your speed and watch out for waves in this brilliant water-racing sequel

editorialNotes.standard: Developer Jan Ilavsky came up with the idea for this gorgeous Apple Design Award winner after heâ€™d broken his arm. He started on an infinite runner that could be played one-handed, and since heâ€™s also colourblind, he added a gameplay element about changing between vibrant neon colours. Chameleon Run succeeds beautifully, balancing wicked speed with irresistible, just-one-more-try challenges.
editorialNotes.short: You'll need quick reactions in this intense polychromatic platformer.

editorialNotes.standard: In Hello Games' side-scrolling racer, you control the eponymous stunt devil as he jumps, wheelies and backflips through a huge assortment of death-defying levels. With tricks to master, costumes to unlock and leaderboards to conquer, Joe Danger is a wacky blast. Youâ€™ll don an Elvis getup, evade flying saucers and soar over shark tanks in increasingly treacherous tracks. After all, they donâ€™t call him Joe Danger for nothing.

name: Flight Unlimited Las Vegas - Flight Simulator

editorialNotes.standard: There sure is a lot of debris in space. So if you want to survive as an intergalactic pilot, youâ€™ll need to think fast. Thankfully, dodging and weaving through Hyperburnerâ€™s gorgeous levels is pure exhilaration. We love how beating stages â€œrewardsâ€ us with faster shipsâ€”it means the better we get, the harder the game gets.
